data.title: 11 hurt as school van overturns in Surat Thani
data.description: SURAT THANI: Nine students and two teachers returning from a camping activity were injured when their van overturned in Kanchanadit district of this southern province on Friday afternoon.

data.title: AI to help raise access to quality education
data.description: BURI RAM - The Ministry of Education is calling on schools nationwide to improve the quality of their teaching to align with the latest technology including  artificial intelligence , according to Deputy Education Minister Surasak Phancharoenworakul.

data.title: 2 students killed, 12 hurt as truck hits school pickup
data.description: PATTANI: Two students were killed and 12 others hurt, one badly, when a six-wheel truck hit a parked pickup carrying students in Sai Buri district of this southern province on Friday.

data.title: Veterinarian ‘didn’t knock out TV cat’
data.description: The person who anaesthetised a black  cat  in the TV drama  The Empress of Ayodhaya , also known as Mae Yua, was not a veterinarian but someone from the agency that provided the animal, according to the Department of Livestock Development.

data.title: Thunderstorms to blanket Greater Bangkok as rain refuses to let up
data.description: Rain is predicted in Bangkok and its vicinity until Monday, according to the Meteorological Department.

data.title: Thai soldiers ‘tortured and killed Myanmar migrant’, rights group says
data.description: A human rights group has called on Thai authorities to fully investigate three soldiers for the “horrific” death of a Myanmar migrant on the border in Tak province earlier this year, saying they had tortured and beaten the man.

data.title: EC explains new Provincial Administrative Organisations poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.

data.title: State Railway of Thailand defies Department of Lands in Buri Ram dispute
data.description: The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) has appealed the Department of Lands (DoL) decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram

data.title: Prime Minister Paetongtarn advances key agendas at Apec forum
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  will meet Chinese President  Xi Jinping  and other world leaders at the four-day 31st  Apec Economic Leaders

data.title: Leopard spotted in Kaeng Krachan park
data.description: A leopard was spotted wandering around a helipad in Kaeng Krachan National Park in Phetchaburi province, believed to be waiting for its prey.

data.title: Headless dugong found floating off Phuket coast
data.description: A headless dugong was found floating near a pier in Phuket on Thursday, making it the third dead dugong reported this month.

data.title: Frenchman charged for illegally possessing baby macaques
data.description: A Frenchman has been charged with illegally keeping four young macaques after sharing their photos on social media.

data.title: People's Party submits push to limit Senate's role
data.description: One of the proposals for an amendment to the constitution submitted by the People

data.title: Paetongtarn to visit Malaysia to boost ties, trade
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will visit Malaysia next month in a bid to further strengthen ties and boost trade while also working on improving border security.

data.title: EC explains new PAO poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.

data.title: Prolonged floods in Chiang Mai raise subsidence risk
data.description: Experts are warning of possible landslides and subsidence in parts of Chiang Dao district in Chiang Mai, as the ground in the area is saturated with water after two months of floods.

data.title: PP submits push to limit Senate's role
data.description: One of the proposals for an amendment to the constitution submitted by the People

data.title: SRT defies DoL in Buri Ram dispute
data.description: The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) has appealed the Department of Lands (DoL) decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram

data.title: PM to visit Malaysia to boost ties, trade
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will visit Malaysia next month in a bid to further strengthen ties and boost trade while also working on improving border security.

data.title: Terminal named one of world's best
data.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport

data.title: PM advances key agendas at Apec forum
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping and other world leaders at the four-day 31st Apec Economic Leaders

data.title: Ex-PM sees no risk to Pheu Thai
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra is confident the Pheu Thai-led coalition government will get to complete a full term in office.

data.title: US embassy returns Ban Chiang artefacts
data.description: Four 3,000-year-old  Ban Chiang  artefacts were returned on Thursday from the United States to Thailand.

data.title: Trio busted for child trafficking
data.description: Two Thais and a Myanmar citizen were arrested in Chon Buri on Thursday on charges of trafficking a 10-year-old girl from Myanmar to work as their “slave”.

data.title: Four Africans held for prostitution in Phuket
data.description: PHUKET - Three Ugandan nationals and one woman from Tanzania have been arrested on the resort island for selling sex.

data.title: Global diabetes cases far higher than estimates
data.description: LONDON - More than 800 million adults have  diabetes  worldwide — almost twice as many as previous estimates have suggested — and more than half of those aged over 30 who have the condition are not receiving treatment, according to a new study.

data.title: Pattani motorcycle bomb injures 5 police officers
data.description: PATTANI: Five border patrol police officers were injured when a  motorcycle bomb  went off as their truck drove over a bridge in Yaring district of this southern province on Thursday afternoon.

data.title: Policeman drowns while chasing drug suspect
data.description: PHRAE - A 22-year-old police officer was discovered dead from drowning in river during a chase of a fleeing drug suspect.

data.title: Thaksin’s Udon Thani vote pitch raises eyebrows
data.description: Former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  might have broken a local  election law  by telling people in  Udon Thani  to “vote for Thaksin” while campaigning for a provincial Pheu Thai Party candidate there, says a former election commissioner.

data.title: Two Myanmar men gunned down in Ratchaburi
data.description: Two Myanmar men working in Samut Sakhon were found dead from gunshot wounds in Suan Phung district of Ratchaburi province early Thursday.

data.title: Korean live streamer arrested for injuring massage operator
data.description: PATTAYA — A Korean live streamer has been arrested for allegedly injuring the owner of a massage parlour while attempting to block his live coverage of a client

data.title: Thaksin to be quizzed on PGH stay
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra will be summoned by a House committee to provide information related to claims that he received privileged treatment at Police General Hospital (PGH) during his detention there.

data.title: Jailed Sittra grilled over Senate run
data.description: Embattled  lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd  was quizzed on Wednesday by election officials for allegedly having run for the Senate despite being unqualified to seek the post.

data.title: Bangkok traffic alert as construction starts
data.description: Motorists have been warned to expect heavy  traffic congestion  as the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) will close and demolish three key traffic flyovers during construction of the Orange Line electric train route, which starts on Friday.

data.title: Study-work policy to keep kids in class
data.description: The Digital Economy and Society Ministry is pushing a policy allowing students to earn additional income while studying in a bid to bring out-of-school children back into the classroom.
